He obtained his PhD degree in computer science from the University of Cagliari in 2017. Before joining the GSSI, he worked at the universities of Cagliari, Kent, Trento and Bologna with postdoctoral positions. His research interest lies in theoretical computer science, concurrency theory and programming languages, with emphasis on formal modelling and verification of concurrent systems.
